alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Montgomery; Randolph; Stanly (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 10:14PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Davidson, northwestern Montgomery, southwestern Randolph and northeastern Stanly Counties through 1115 PM EDT... At 1014 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles east of High Rock Lake, or 13 miles southeast of Lexington, moving southwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lexington, Albemarle, Badin Lake, Plyler, Badin, Denton, Richfield, New London, Eldorado and Gordontown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
